statement.p: I saw a job opening for a Cartoonist that pays \displaystyle\${85},{000} per year salary. Assume that a regular work week for this job is \displaystyle{44} hours, and that you will work \displaystyle{50} weeks in a year.
What is the hourly pay for this job? We will answer the question by converting 85,000 per year into dollars per hour.

If we begin with the fraction \displaystyle\frac{{\${85000}}}{\text{year}}, we can multiply by two unit fractions to complete the conversion. What are these fractions? Choose the correct fractions in the calculation below:
Finally, what is the hourly pay for this job?

myopenmath.solution:
B: 1 year/50 weeks
A: 1 week/44 hours
38.64
For this job, we know the following conversion facts:
1 year = 85000 dollars
1 year = 50 weeks
1 week = 44 hours
So, we can convert the yearly rate of 85,000 per year into dollars per hour by the following calculation:
\displaystyle\frac{{\${85000}}}{{\color{red}\cancel{{\text{year}}}}}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ {\color{red}\cancel{{\text{year}}}}}}{{{50}\ {\color{blue}\cancel{{\text{weeks}}}}}}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ {\color{blue}\cancel{{\text{week}}}}}}{{{44}\ \text{hours}}}=\frac{{\${85000}\cdot{1}\cdot{1}}}{{{1}\cdot{50}\cdot{44}\ \text{hours}}}
\displaystyle\approx\frac{\text{\$}}{\text{hour}}
So, the position pays dollars/hour.
